values.description:
* disable Run button for already (successfully) started rounds in the constellation

* Display traffic parameters

* Disable upon click

* Disable all Run buttons

* some minor label changes to replace Github by generic Git repo

* Close branch labels-github-to-git

* Stop forcing upon a state change

* Comment update

* Close branch disable-run-for-started-rounds

* fix to valid harness in 0 being displayed as N/A

* Close branch several-round-clicks

* Close branch fix-harness-display-na

* update to read tc data from fieldcomputer

* removing traffic info from results for now

* Close branch traffic_report

* avoid replacing .

* Close branch const_name

* update latency label

* Close branch latency_label

values.description:
In this PR I address [CLOUD-98](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-98). Note that this requires the following PR from the Portal: [Delete Metrics Configs](#!/osrf/cloudsim-portal/pull-requests/101/delete-metric-configs/diff) (already merged).

With the route implemented, this PR provides a way to delete metrics configs from the UI, following the same style of Machine Types and Keys.

ptal @andres_fortier

![deletemetrics.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/2913901986-deletemetrics.gif 'deletemetrics.gif')
values.title: Delete button in User Metrics

values.description:
In this PR I address [CLOUD-114](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-114). From the User Metrics dialog, we can grant permissions. Now, we can see a list of current permissions and have a way to revoke them.

This is done in a similar way to Machine Types and Keys.

ptal @andres_fortier   
  
Note: There might be a slight overlap with [this PR](#!/osrf/cloudsim-widgets/pull-requests/204) as they both refer to the User Metrics element.

![revoke2.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/3335187877-revoke2.gif 'revoke2.gif')
values.title: Show and Revoke permissions in User Metrics

values.description:
In this PR I address [CLOUD-164](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-164).

The Iron Data Table element, whenever a row is clicked, fires a "selecting item" event. When this happens, we open the configuration dialog.

A click on a row toggles the selection, so the event doesn't fires when it's being deselected. As no visual feedback is provided for the selection, this might be misleading: The row is clicked but the dialog doesn't shows up.

As no other event lets us change this behavior, we can prevent this by clearing the selection of the row every time one is selected. This causes clicks to always fire the data table's `on-selecting-item` event.

With the callback of this event, we need to call a `setTimeout`, to let the dialog render as desired.

ptal @andres_fortier

Notice that the change is repeated through Keys, Machine Types and User Metrics elements.
values.title: Data table click

summary.raw:
In this PR I address [CLOUD-164](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-164).

The Iron Data Table element, whenever a row is clicked, fires a "selecting item" event. When this happens, we open the configuration dialog.

A click on a row toggles the selection, so the event doesn't fires when it's being deselected. As no visual feedback is provided for the selection, this might be misleading: The row is clicked but the dialog doesn't shows up.

As no other event lets us change this behavior, we can prevent this by clearing the selection of the row every time one is selected. This causes clicks to always fire the data table's `on-selecting-item` event.

With the callback of this event, we need to call a `setTimeout`, to let the dialog render as desired.

ptal @andres_fortier

Notice that the change is repeated through Keys, Machine Types and User Metrics elements.
summary.html:
In this PR I address CLOUD-164.

The Iron Data Table element, whenever a row is clicked, fires a "selecting item" event. When this happens, we open the configuration dialog.

A click on a row toggles the selection, so the event doesn't fires when it's being deselected. As no visual feedback is provided for the selection, this might be misleading: The row is clicked but the dialog doesn't shows up.

As no other event lets us change this behavior, we can prevent this by clearing the selection of the row every time one is selected. This causes clicks to always fire the data table's on-selecting-item event.

With the callback of this event, we need to call a setTimeout, to let the dialog render as desired.

ptal @andres_fortier

Notice that the change is repeated through Keys, Machine Types and User Metrics elements.

values.description:
In this PR I address [CLOUD-93](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-93). When we press "Start one now" or \+ buttons, we change the page to launch a new constellation. To exit this page, round tabs can be clicked (if any) or a refresh had to be done.

A back button was included. This makes the user go to the "empty" page, or to the first round, if any is present.

**Note**: A center tag was changed into a div, but there was another center tag in which the change was not trivial. More information on this issue: [CLOUD-175](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-175)

ptal @andres_fortier

![backbtn.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/1956063322-backbtn.gif 'backbtn.gif')
values.title: Back button when launching a Constellation

A back button was included. This makes the user go to the "empty" page, or to the first round, if any is present.

**Note**: A center tag was changed into a div, but there was another center tag in which the change was not trivial. More information on this issue: [CLOUD-175](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-175)

ptal @andres_fortier

![backbtn.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/1956063322-backbtn.gif 'backbtn.gif')
summary.html:
In this PR I address CLOUD-93. When we press "Start one now" or + buttons, we change the page to launch a new constellation. To exit this page, round tabs can be clicked (if any) or a refresh had to be done.

A back button was included. This makes the user go to the "empty" page, or to the first round, if any is present.

Note: A center tag was changed into a div, but there was another center tag in which the change was not trivial. More information on this issue: CLOUD-175

ptal @andres_fortier

values.description:
In this PR I address [CLOUD-76](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-76).

The logout button is changed for an avatar, which by clicking it, shows some short information and allows the user to go to their profile and logout. This requires changes in `gz-token` element, made in this PR: [https://github.com/osrf/gz-token/pull/9](https://github.com/osrf/gz-token/pull/9). The profile information comes from [Auth0](https://auth0.com/docs/user-profile/normalized).

ptal @andres_fortier 

GIF

![profilebtn.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/3509515348-profilebtn.gif 'profilebtn.gif')
values.title: Profile Image and Dialog

This requires changes in `gz-token` element, made in this PR: [https://github.com/osrf/gz-token/pull/9](https://github.com/osrf/gz-token/pull/9). The logout button is changed for an avatar, which by clicking it, shows some short information and allows the user to go to their profile and logout. This requires changes in gz-token element, made in this PR: https://github.com/osrf/gz-token/pull/9. The profile information comes from Auth0.

ptal @andres_fortier

GIF

values.description:
* Bring launcher and machine list back to dashboard.
* Launcher now uses `machinetypes` (no more hardcoded types)
* Launcher only shows for users who have write permission to `simulators`
* Added copy-to-clipboard for machine IP on item


## User who can launch machines

![launcher.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/3248412523-launcher.gif)


## User who can't launch machines but has access to some machines (there would be no machines listed if they don't have access to any)

![launcherno.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/1196718187-launcherno.png)
values.title: Revive launcher

summary.raw:
* Bring launcher and machine list back to dashboard.
* Launcher now uses `machinetypes` (no more hardcoded types)
* Launcher only shows for users who have write permission to `simulators`
* Added copy-to-clipboard for machine IP on item


## User who can launch machines

![launcher.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/3248412523-launcher.gif)


## User who can't launch machines but has access to some machines (there would be no machines listed if they don't have access to any)

![launcherno.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/1196718187-launcherno.png)
summary.html:
• Bring launcher and machine list back to dashboard.
  • Launcher now uses machinetypes (no more hardcoded types)
  • Launcher only shows for users who have write permission to simulators
  • Added copy-to-clipboard for machine IP on item

User who can launch machines

User who can't launch machines but has access to some machines (there would be no machines listed if they don't have access to any)
